article: A little boy was spending his Saturday morning playing in his sandbox. While creating roads in the soft sand, he _ a large rock in the middle of the sandbox. The boy _ around the rock, managing to move it out from the dirt. With much _ , he tried to push the rock out of the sandbox. When the boy got the rock to the edge of the sandbox, _ , he found that he couldn t _ it up and over the little wall. The rock was too _ for his small body. As he _ to accept his failure, the little boy dug, pushed, and pried, but every time he thought he had made some _ , the rock rolled and then fell back into the sandbox. The little boy _ again and again, but the only _ was to have the rock roll back. _ , he burst into tears. All this time the boy s father _ him from his living room. The moment the tears fell, a _ voice rose above the boy s head. It was his father. _ , but firmly he said, Son, why didn t you use all the _ that you had? The boy replied with tears, But I did, Daddy, I did! I _ all that I had! No, son, you didn t, _ the father kindly. You didn t _ me to help you. With that the father picked up the rock and _ it out of the sandbox. Are you discovering that you don t have the strength to move your rocks away? There is ONE who is always willing to _ you with the strength you need. We also need that strength, especially in our daily life.
